main event: A bright, white to dull orange object in the sky was observed by a civilian radar instructor in Biloxi, Mississippi in September 1954. The object was initially bright, then rapidly diminished in intensity and size before being joined by three more similar objects, forming a box pattern. The observation lasted for 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object changed in size and intensity, and was joined by three more similar objects very suddenly, forming a box pattern.
The observation was labeled as 'PROBABLY AIRCRAFT' in the conclusion, implying uncertainty.
There were no photographs or physical evidence associated with the sighting.
The civilian witness was a radar instructor at Keesler AFB Technical Schools, adding credibility to the observation.
No logical explanation was offered after analysis and interrogation of the witness.
sighted object: bright, white to dull orange object in the sky
witnesses: civilian radar instructor at Keesler AFB Technical Schools
